podigious 146711413289 "2016-06-30 17:23:41 GMT" http://podigious.tumblr.com/post/146711413289/my-digimon-tri-recording-experience "jeffnimoyanime: Holy DigiCrap
column2: one little announcement and the whole Internet goes crazy! I had no idea that the English dubbing of Digimon Tri wasn’t public knowledge until I announced I recorded Tentomon again. No one asked me not to tell anyone
column3: so I guess it’s ok to talk about it. I am getting flooded with questions
column4: so rather than answering each one individually
column5: here is how it all happened.For a long time now fans kept asking me if I was going to be in Digimon Tri. My last experience with Digimon was script adaptation
column8: and being Supervising Producer on Digimon Data Squad (previously Digimon Savers). Even though it’s the least known series in the franchise
column10: so I hope this renewed 15th anniversary interest in Digimon makes fans give it a second look. Since then I knew they dubbed Fusion without me
column11: so I assumed whatever production company was in charge of the franchise now had moved on without me.But then I got a call from Studiopolis and asked me to voice Tentomon again for Tri. They didn’t ask me to write or direct
column13: I would have loved to do all those things again for Digimon
column14: but even just the involvement of voice acting is thrilling enough because it means a return to the series that I loved and made me famous (plus
column15: there are a lot less headaches and a lot less work to do when you’re only acting).I came back to the familiar Studiopolis offices and met an engineer/voice director named Ryan. Never met him before
column16: and he didn’t tell me his last name
column17: so that’s all I know. But he was a very nice guy
column18: and seemed to know the series well
column19: and he was a very good director. There were 4 episodes written
column20: but I can’t remember if Tentomon was in all of them or not.I had just got off a redeye flight from New York
column21: and my voice was rather raw. I actually asked if they would reschedule because I didn’t think I could get to Tentomon’s higher register until I had a few days rest
column22: but they wanted me to come in and give it a try (Tri?). I did my best
column24: Tentomon might sound a little horse for the first few episodes. 3 days later my voice sounds fine again
column25: so maybe my next session I can go back and re-record the first ones again if they haven’t already mixed the sound (it was only about 8 lines
column26: so we could do it real quick).My last line for Tentomon at that session was “Tentomon digivolve to….Kabuterimon!” Ryan told me he wasn’t sure how they were going to do it
column27: so they wanted me to say “Kabuterimon” in Tentomon’s voice. I told him that Kabuterimon says that part
column29: “Are you sure?” I laughed and said
column31: pretty sure.” Lol. After all those episodes and movies
column32: I had better be sure! Ryan laughed as well and took my word for it. He knew my involvement with the series
column33: so he trusted me. We actually got along quite well
column34: and he was very open to collaboration.During playbacks I recognized some other voices (get ready to break again
column36: and Mona Marshall as Izzy. I’m good friends with Doug Erholtz
column37: so I knew he WASN’T playing TK (he is playing a recurring role though). Ryan told me my old TriGun partner Johnny Yong Bosch was playing TK. I also recognized Laura Summer’s voice as Patomon. Ryan told me almost all the digimon voices are coming back
column38: but many of the humans were recast. That’s ALL I KNOW! Please
column40: you now know exactly what I know
column41: so we’re all caught up!I’m looking forward to my next VO session as Tentomon (although after I blew the surprise
column43: oh well). One more thing… after my session was over
column44: I went into the control room to say goodbye to Ryan
column45: and thank him. We shook hands and I asked
column46: “Please take good care of my baby
column47: won’t you?” He smiled and said
column49: it’s in good hands.” I’m sure it is!" False text

podigious 144555286887 "2016-05-18 15:01:01 GMT" http://podigious.tumblr.com/post/144555286887/new-series-digimon-universe-allegedly-leaked-by "digimon-world-next-order:   May 17th
column2: 2016. Japanese spoiler blog Alternator reported today that the latest issue of V Jump magazine contains an announcement of a new upcoming Digimon series
column3: Digimon Universe Applimonsters. Said to be an Autumn 2016 collaboration between Bandai
column6: Universe Applimonsters is supposed to encompass a toyline
column8: and video games. Alternator acquired the information via a furage (“Flying  Get”) meaning they acquired an issue of the magazine more than a day  ahead of its street date. Such acquisitions are made possible by paying  off middleman distributors
column9: or stores that get their stock early. Alternator’s original statement with an English translation is provided below the jump.  Whether this news is to be regarded as trustworthy or not is a source of contention. The facts are as follows; Alternator has  been around since April 2013
column10: and in that time seems to have maintained  a clean record
column11: not attempting to spread hoaxes. The other statement in  their post
column12: that Dragon Ball Xenoverse 2 will be announced for PlayStation 4
column15: was proven true four and a half hours after they first reported it. Alternator normally labels rumors
column16: but is treating Digimon Universe as fact. No other source has corroborated the Universe  story
column17: but the site also has a number of other claims made around the  same time
column18: and confirming or debunking them may point to the reliability  of the Universe story;  Keep reading  internal screaming good screaming? bad screaming? WHO KNOWS. SO CURIOUS." False text

column1: podigious 142449790899 "2016-04-08 07:39:43 GMT" http://podigious.tumblr.com/post/142449790899/wada-kouji-memories "We’re thinking of doing a special memorial ep to celebrate the impact Wada-san has had on the Digimon community. column2: you can write in through our forum or to our email (podigious at gmail). You can also send in voicemail by emailing a recording or calling 913-CALUMON if you’re in the US. If you want to share a memory with us but don’t want us repeating it on the podcast
column3: just mention that you want us to keep it private." True text
